intro: Argentina rubra, commonly known as the red argentine, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its vibrant red flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is known for its hairy, oval-shaped leaves. Argentina rubra is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking color and unique foliage. It requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
